messages.title: SAVE OUR PARKS CAMPAIGN
messages.content: Plans to sell off our last remaining council-owned parks for development have been met with shock across Worcester.

messages.title: Pressure mounts at Worcester Royal
messages.content: Your Labour candidate Joy has been talking to front-line staff at the hospital.

messages.title: Backing Worcester manufacturing
messages.content: Labour is the party that listens to our manufacturers and acts on their concerns.

messages.title: Childcare
messages.content: Childcare is a big issue across Worcester - Worcester Labour will provide 25 hours free childcare for 3 & 4-year olds.

messages.title: Tackling Immigration
messages.content: Labour would continue to control immigration putting people in and out of the country first.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Tackle the challenges facing Worcester Royal Hospital, listen to front-line staff, and address patient concerns.
Back Worcester manufacturing by listening to manufacturers and acting on their concerns, supporting apprenticeships and infrastructure.
Labour would continue to control immigration system putting people in and out of the country first.
Provide 25 hours free childcare for 3 & 4-year olds to support families in Worcester.
Opposition to the sell-off of council-owned parks for development, emphasizing the need for parks to remain accessible for all.

issues.health: Joy has been talking to front-line staff at the hospital to address challenges and patient concerns.
issues.immigration: Labour would continue to control the immigration system, putting people in and out of the country first.

housing.content: Plans to sell off our last remaining council-owned parks for development have been met with shock; parks should remain accessible for everyone.

images.caption: Joy Squires with affiliates, engaging in campaigning activities.
